SEARCH
Module org.jandle
Package org.jandle.api.http

Interface Response

public interface Response
Represents an HTTP response abstraction used to construct and send responses to a client.

This interface provides a unified API for:

  • Sending fixed-length responses (text, JSON, binary)
  • Streaming responses using chunked transfer encoding
  • Manipulating HTTP headers, status codes, cookies, and redirects

Response Lifecycle

A response follows a strict lifecycle:
  1. Headers and metadata are configured (status, headers, content type, etc.)
  2. The response is committed by calling one of the send*, openStream(), or sendHeaders() methods
  3. After commitment, headers can no longer be modified

Fixed-Length Responses

Methods such as sendText(String), sendJson(Object), and sendBytes(byte[]) automatically:
  • Set the appropriate Content-Length
  • Send the response headers
  • Write the response body

Streaming Responses

Streaming is supported via openStream(), stream(byte[]), flushStream(), and closeStream().

Calling openStream() switches the response to chunked transfer encoding by sending headers with Content-Length = 0. Once streaming has begun, fixed-length responses are no longer permitted.

Thread Safety

Implementations of this interface are not guaranteed to be thread-safe. A Response instance is expected to be used by a single request-handling thread.

Error Handling

Most methods throw IOException if:
  • The response has already been committed
  • An I/O error occurs while writing to the client

Illegal state transitions (e.g. writing to a closed stream) may result in IllegalStateException.

See Also:

  • ResponseCookie

  • Method Details

    • openStream

      void openStream() throws IOException
      Opens the response for streaming (chunked transfer encoding).

      This method sends the response headers immediately with Content-Length = 0, allowing an arbitrary number of stream(byte[]) calls.

      Throws:
      IOException - if the stream is already open or headers cannot be sent

    • stream

      void stream(byte[] chunk) throws IOException
      Writes a chunk of data to the open response stream.

      This method may only be used after openStream() and before closeStream().

      Parameters:
      chunk - the byte array to write
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      IllegalStateException - if the stream is not open or a fixed content length was set

    • flushStream

      void flushStream() throws IOException
      Flushes the underlying output stream if streaming is active.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • closeStream

      void closeStream() throws IOException
      Closes the streaming response.

      After this method is called, no further data may be written.

      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • sendBytes

      void sendBytes(byte[] bytes) throws IOException
      Sends a fixed-length binary response.

      This method automatically sets the correct content length and commits the response.

      Parameters:
      bytes - the response body
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response has already been sent or an I/O error occurs

    • sendHeaders

      void sendHeaders(long contentLength) throws IOException
      Sends the HTTP response headers using the provided content length.

      This method commits the response and must be called exactly once.

      Parameters:
      contentLength - the content length
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent

    • sendHeaders

      void sendHeaders() throws IOException
      Sends the HTTP response headers using the internally configured content length.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent

    • sendText

      void sendText(String message) throws IOException
      Sends a plain-text response using UTF-8 encoding.
      Parameters:
      message - the response body
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent or an I/O error occurs

    • sendJson

      void sendJson(Object src) throws IOException
      Sends a JSON response serialized using Gson.
      Parameters:
      src - the object to serialize
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent or an I/O error occurs

    • sendStatus

      void sendStatus(int statusCode) throws IOException
      Sends a response with no body and the given HTTP status code.
      Parameters:
      statusCode - the HTTP status code
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent

    • redirect

      void redirect(int statusCode, String location) throws IOException
      Sends an HTTP redirect with the specified status code and location.
      Parameters:
      statusCode - the redirect status code (e.g. 301, 302, 307)
      location - the target location
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent

    • redirect

      void redirect(String location) throws IOException
      Sends a temporary (302) redirect to the given location.
      Parameters:
      location - the target location
      Throws:
      IOException - if the response was already sent

    • header

      Response header(String key, String... valueList)
      Sets or replaces a response header.
      Parameters:
      key - the header name
      valueList - the header values
      Returns:
      this response for chaining

    • getHeaders

      Headers getHeaders()
      Returns a copy of the current response headers.

      Modifications to the returned Headers object will not affect the actual headers sent in the HTTP response.

      Returns:
      a Headers object containing all the current headers.

    • contentType

      Response contentType(String contentType)
      Sets or removes the Content-Type header.
      Parameters:
      contentType - the content type, or null to remove it
      Returns:
      this response for chaining

    • contentLength

      Response contentLength(long contentLength)
      Sets the content length for the response.

      Passing a 0 switches the response to chunked mode.

      Passing a negative value removes the header "Content-Length".

      Parameters:
      contentLength - the content length
      Returns:
      this response for chaining

    • status

      Response status(int statusCode)
      Sets the HTTP status code for the response.
      Parameters:
      statusCode - the HTTP status code
      Returns:
      this response for chaining

    • cookie

      Response cookie(ResponseCookie cookie)
      Adds a Set-Cookie header to the response.
      Parameters:
      cookie - the response cookie
      Returns:
      this response for chaining

    • vary

      Response vary(String value)
      Adds a value to the Vary response header if not already present.
      Parameters:
      value - the header value to add
      Returns:
      this response for chaining
